7a53xU9IC4CjxRV2ESdv3Q.text: Why 1 star? Because of some of the most rude customer service I've ever received.    ---   ---   ---  I did not plan on writing this review today, but after some of the most egregious customer service I've ever received, I could not resist. For those who regularly see my reviews, you'll notice two common comments:  1) I try not to kill a business with a review due to one part-time employee having a bad day.  2) I've written nearly 1,100 reviews, and only 9 are 1-star, at the time of this visit. I try to be positive, even when a place doesn't offer a ton of positivity.   With that being said, let me paint the scene:  -My flight from Tampa-Charlotte was delayed, so I had to sprint from Terminal E - Terminal B while wearing Tom's and carrying 2 bags.  -I arrived at my gate, feeling like I just ran a marathon, only to learn that I missed the opportunity to board by 2 minutes. Awesome.  -I made arrangements to board the next flight and felt the need to find a good beer.  -How convenient? Right next to my gate was a restaurant/bar, called Whiskey River!   -I take two steps in to said establishment, look for the beer taps at the bar, and realize that there aren't any within sight.   -I turn around and ask the one of hostesses if she has a beer list I can see. She hands me a menu.  ***THE FUN PART***  -The other hostess (named Kaylan) then addresses the other hostess and loudly asks, "Hey _____, can you tell me what the sign right outside the restaurant says?"  Other hostess: "See hostess to be seated."  Kaylan: "Ohhhh that's what I thought! And can you tell me what the sign back there, just beyond that sign says?"  Other hostess: "See hostess to be seated."  Kaylan: "Yes, that's what I thought too!"  I drop menu back on hostess stand, and walk away.  Apparently Kaylan found it wildly inappropriate that I took two steps inside the threshold of the business to look at the taps, without addressing her first. She then dealt with the situation in the most rude way possible. I can't recall dealing with someone that rude at a restaurant in all of the time I've been writing Yelp reviews. If I were the owner, there is a zero percent chance that she would be employed another day.  I have never written a review of a business without actually purchasing something, and I have never written a review within 30 minutes of an experiencing a place. This situation was so outrageous that I felt like I had no choice.

HbIAd8kUYxDOeSXKtaTH0A.text: I was surprised at how great my experience was here! Understanding that this is an airport joint, I sat down at the bar and was immediately taken care of. My water was always full, and my bartender made an extra effort to make conversation with me, along with other people at the bar.  My food order was placed immediately (Dirty Tots!) and came out in a timely manner, which is ALWAYS really appreciated in an airport. I think that most of the apps are served in a warm cast iron mini skillet, which is a neat presentation. Taste was on point as well!    Anyways, I can't really give this place 5 stars, but it was a really great experience to have. Glad to know that there's an adequate dining experience in lonely 'ol Terminal E.

InPOYSdwxLqurW_CF599dg.text: Sat at the bar. Multiple TVs with college football on, just about every game. For airport food it was pretty good. Waited on by really nice bartender. He was hard working and very friendly.

d3hZwoz4LV3JB6T_-550bw.text: Airport. Wings 1 lb? Need to look up how many wingetts should be in pound. Asked for dry but got with sauce on. Too messy to take on plane will stress this next time if I return-not likely. Even with sauce too dry. Had side of broccoli perfect.

kMkb08TsZ5cgoEV-_q4Z3g.text: Food mediocre and service terrible. No silver ware, beverage refill offers, or notice that I didn't eat most of my food... and still When I paid my check I was asked " do you need change" -- the equivalent of "are you leaving a tip for me?"

hngdJsTK2zKMZq7gU-7KRQ.text: Passing through Charlotte airport and meal at Whisky River caused salmonella food poisoning.  After many test, visits to medical facility, and prescriptions it was not only confirmed but finally cured.  Most likely cause would be poor food handling and cleaning.

RFUqa3JsF83z4QVSxWFZLg.text: Yuck, buffalo chicken ranch wrap was bland and cole slaw side was a lazy dump of mayo. As far as airport food standards go, this is below the bar - by a lot.

_CVhZ1wZh14_RGkY2saAHg.text: Airport eating at it's worst.  I ordered a chicken salad that was basically all white lettuce.  Didn't even include what was specified on menu.  Fries were over cooked and tasteless.  We had waters, a pulled pork sandwich, wings, and a salad for $47.  If you are vegetarian or care at all about the healthiness (or quality for that matter) of your food, go somewhere else.  Just go here for nachos and drinks.  On a plus side, our server was very nice and the other staff we talked to were all very kind as well.

v-tPUY4HCdATmdB5Y7smeA.text: Fantastic quick breakfast service. Get the yogurt parfait, a big bowl at a great price. Waiter couldn't have been better, very attentive!!

cPVyyUyd891uoTK6WErfPw.text: I was rushing for the Charlotte airport this is of my stop. Great southern food with a large menu and drinks. Extremely interesting decor

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plenty of televisions nearby to watch the games
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wish just restaurant was back north

1F6I_5MK2q1iHYoZKrYHoQ.text: I came here during a layover. Kersten was my waitress and she was great! I couldn't decide between the brisket grilled cheese or dirty tots. She recommended the dirty tots with the shredded brisket (instead of pork). AND IT WAS AMAZING. That BBQ sauce with a little heat and the brisket? Mm. Exactly what I wanted. And they've got some good local beers. Definitely don't let the low stars scare ya. They're worth it.

AvoMA3x4_KMz8PyM_VR4QA.text: Food is average drinks are average. But it is in the airport and at that The busiest part of clt. Easy seating and the food comes out fast.

1FIj7ZPg2u3a9xBi6kE9bw.text: Had a great mushroom Swiss burger at both visits. First time sat at the bar and had great service while watching hockey on one of the many TVs above the bar. 2nd time sat out on the outside counter area by the mechanical bull and had equally great service. They can be crowded and busy depending on flight traffic but I would definitely come here again if my layover allowed. A nice spot in an otherwise run-down airport. Didn't realize the specialty drink on the menu I ordered was more than my burger so check the prices first if that's a concern.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fireball &amp; Ginger ale with a splash of cranberry

JjpQtX1O7XaMkrnpiDaFkg.text: This place was terrible. First, a large local beer is $14!! Of course, you don't know that you've spent $28 for 2 beers until you get the check. I get that higher prices should be expected at an airport but that is ridiculous. Second, a burger cooked to medium should not be bright red and cold to the touch in the middle. Third, apparently they soak their burger buns in the sink before putting burgers on them. To top it all off, the service is well below average, even for an airport joint.  The only reason for 1 star (vs no stars) is the fact that they had a single local beer in tap and one of the bartenders was easy on the eyes.

KJIB6p3wVc-BS_NrZrKtgA.text: First time at an airport bar that I felt that I was an inconvenience to the bartender. I would have stayed and ordered more drinks but the bartender made it clear that she was in no mood to have me as a customer.  Warning to anyone not from NC: stay clear of this place.

vM2a6aO0DcYo38Pj7lVGPQ.text: The service here is terrible, I visited on a Sunday evening. It's not even busy. Took 10-15min to order and even get my drinks. For an airport and business travelers they should be much quicker than this.  I have been here 30min and haven't received my food. This is kind of ridiculous. The beer I ordered isn't even all that cold. Still waiting on food.

tsKEDi-8lLiUwbXTf4IfMg.text: I travel quite a bit, and between the service and quality of food, this ranked up there as far as 'bad' experiences.  I ordered a blue cheese salad with boneless wings.  The 'wings' barely contained chicken and instead were 95% batter.  My server also had zero concept of time, or how to refill drinks.  In short, if you are looking for a 'quick' bite at the CLT airport, I would recommend another place.  The food here was not good at all, and the service not much better.

pSIkCQlNQ6H2XLNEtsC64A.text: Service and food is great no need to right a long review. Only negative is that it's very expensive which is what you expect at the airport. Yes I would recommend. Want a cheap but good dish while waiting for your flight get a quesadilla... delicious!

rIa9x_m9qxb7UJujXSt0Pw.text: 'There are kids starving in Africa...'. But they wouldn't eat this stuff!  Ordered the boneless wings and they were so stale and dried out that they were more like left over bones.  I sent them back and you would've thought I tried to rob the place, as the waiter argued that they were fine - even if you couldn't stick a fork into them.    To replace that pile of dog food, I ordered chili cheese fries (I know, I'm a real health nut!) and they came out with a strange soupy mix that made the fries soggier than soft boiled eggs...  maybe a fork of meat, a dozen red beans and some shredded cheese sprinkled very lightly on top of the potato soup.  Yuck!  All around it was a very bad experience and I only gave them one star because there aren't lower ratings.

RxpDyEse2d6y6qi2LI7I7g.text: I know airport restaurants aren't the same as city eateries but be aware Whisky River is not sensitive to flights, short stays and deadlines. Nor are they by any means good. I had an hour and got seated right away but that was the last of the quick service an airport restaurant should have. It took 20 minutes to get a beer 45 for a horribly under cooked Patty Melt, asked for medium and God a burger that had blood soaked bread. If I were squeamish that would be the end. But I asked for the check as soon as the food came and it took 15 more to get them to cash me out.  If you're in a rush don't stop here it's not worth the wait.

vlvToWl7OgCjVSU9aD8GJg.text: Skip this place. Drinks are WAYYYYYY overpriced and not good enough (barely any alcohol) in a place with the name "Whiskey" in it. Food is mediocre at best. They served us a frozen peach cobbler in a red hot skillet - that takes some talent, or rather a lack of giving a damn. There are much better alternatives in this airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

_ux9YvMSqO7PfGh4qkw1KQ.text: We really enjoyed the food, live music and great service from Ginny!  Try the buffalo chicken burger and Cobb salad. Nice restaurant for a layover.

gSq-ZCtQ50KL4hnUxRu1iA.text: This is an airport location, terrible experience. I ordered an appetizer item to go because I had a flight to catch within 40 minutes. They took my order right away and I began waiting. I ended up waiting 30 minutes when I had no choice but to ask the host to check on the food for me. She came back after a few minutes and had another guests food who ordered 10 minutes after I had, she said mine should be out soon. I asked her to refund me because my flight was being sat. She told me she wanted to get the manager and check on the food again. After a couple more minutes, I told the other hostess about what was going on, she said okay and continued seating other guests. The manager finally came up front, at this point my girlfriend had the flight being held, he started asking me about my order and I told him my flight was about to leave and I needed my money back. After him playing with the computer and showing no urgency I told him forget it. $15 wasn't worth me missing my flight. After that he got me my money and I had to run to my flight. Horrible service, no sense of urgency and poor manners from the four staff members I dealt with. I would not recommend this restaurant.

nAfNryaOl0yKjnVJCm_sog.text: Worst service ever. Arrived there at 8:55. Placed order. 9:18 still no good. Waitress brings coffee with no sugar. Had to cancel order due to waiting to long for good to arrive. My plane started boarding already. It's no way in the world that it takes over 20 minutes for some bacon, cheese eggs, and grits. Totally ruined my whole day. Way to go.

7apdWx2tMpetc6XqdbUAOQ.text: I think this place is a great find.. especially for airport food. They have live music and very good food! Priced a little high but remember it's the airport.. all in all, I'd walk the length of Terminal 2 to get this food without hesitation.

sAFnIv3qhtmmVCztNbllMQ.text: Got in early on the red eye from Phoenix, so we were the first folks here. I think our breakfast was leftovers from last night. Except the eggs. They were fresh. But the grits, sausage and bacon tasted like they were cooked yesterday.  Maybe not. But if they were cooked today they were poorly done.

mkeQqp3jlfKMlF4dPBkbtQ.text: Do NOT think this place is going to be a good place to grab a bite to eat.   Absolutely so horrid that I saved my receipt after being out of the country for a month so I could write a review!  The food is just embarrassingly horrible.  The service was equally so. I am assuming that since they figure 90% will never return thru the area, that they can do such a bad job with both.  Too expensive for food that you honestly believe you will get sick off of if you take more than a bite.  My first ever 1 star given to anyone on Yelp, and that is only because they do not have a "0"  8/24/18 receipt number 307507

eYcxYCI9xYvAfcMc8jfisQ.text: I'm not usually one to rave about airport food, but I had a great experience at Whiskey River in the Charlotte Airport. I had a 3 hour layover and wanted a sit-down meal instead of grabbing fast food. Whiskey River caught my eye because the place was pretty full and they had live music inside. They also have a large bar space and a huge wall covered in belt buckles- I was sold.   I was seated immediately and the waiter was prompt and attentive. I had a glass of wine, which was actually pretty decent. But my sandwich was the real star of the show! I loved the brisket grilled cheese. Although it could've been a little cheesier, it was packed full of delicious brisket. There are many sides to choose from, and their fries were pretty good. This is a neat little place to grab a drink or some food if you have time to kill in the airport.

rMNm6bVYXuM8v2EquaPZ5Q.text: It was 10 PM and we felt pretty lucky to find somewhere still doing full service. We got the pulled pork sandwich and the brisket grilled cheese and thought they were just fine, especially for airport food. The brisket was a little saltier than I would have personally preferred. However, plus one star for some really excellent service. Everyone was warm and welcoming, and our water glass never went past half full without being refilled.

b1t__c1YiZOq8fWvIDSS9A.text: Forget the food, what a pathetic service!  been sitting here since 30 minutes now with no one bothered to ask anything.

jgn-DZKZKACh21a49uiooQ.text: Well it's an airport joint so I didn't expect much and on that score, Whisky River delivers. Just terrible airport food and short pours. The bland, overcooked burger was bathed in "guac" that I suspect had been stored for a month in a 55-gallon barrel that was previously used to hold stale oil or unfortunate gangster corpses, along with a generous dump of a some indiscernible "chipotle" sauce (which I suspect has less to do with chipotle peppers and perhaps more to do with the contents of the mop bucket after a Chipotle restaurant's late night cleanup. It all came delivered on a Wonder bun and came with a side of tasteless, anemic fries.   I admit that I get sucked in by anything that has "whisky" or "whiskey" in the name, suspecting that I can at least get a tasty libation. But either the bartender is missing a finger or they have children pouring at the bar. A single is also known as "one finger", principally because you measure it according to the thickness of, well, a real finger. But if you're digitally impaired, I guess you have to wing it.   This place just totally sucks.

rGcl-vGtFAptdeW1FHZgFA.text: Over priced average food. Service was fine and timely. Pulled pork was OK but small for the price. One in our party really like the French fries.

0XgzITT3TOaCE8l4NzxoLA.text: I love a good airport bar. In fact, they are second only two a solid hotel bar. Why is this? The hustle and bustle of people coming and going; the random oddballs you sit next to and converse with that you will never see again; that first sip of a drink that you enjoy even more knowing that you are about to embark on vacation. All of this makes the inflated prices at these places somewhat tolerable.  So when I found myself on a two and half hour layover in CLT while en route to Myrtle Beach last week, I jumped at the chance to partake in some airport bar eating and drinking.   Charlotte/Douglas is home to one of my favorite airport bars, Rum Bar and Grill (formerly Bacardi Grill). And despite the map saying that it was adjacent to the terminal where I was, I just couldn't find it. So I stumbled into Whisky River and found a random seat. I was greeted by a bartender who was somewhat pleasant, though seemingly indifferent.  I ordered a beer and a BBQ chicken salad. As is usually the case at an airport lounge, the food and drink came out rather quickly, but I wasn't especially excited by the salad.  It was a little too heavy on the BBQ flavor to the point that the lettuce bordered on soggy. The flavor was solid, but the wet consistency of the salad itself weirded me out.   Maybe it was the day or the time of day, but the vibe at Whisky River just didn't seem one that was particularly enjoyable or friendly.  Don't get me wrong, I wasn't looking for a boisterous and drunken time (like that time my buddy and I tied one on at Gordon Biersch in Atlanta-Hartsfield during a 3 hour layover flying home from FLL), but I'd have liked more interaction with the bartender, server, or even fellow patrons. Also, for a whisky bar, there didn't seem to be that many options. I may be wrong (I'm not much of a whisky drinker), but I didn't see that wide a variety of whisky choices.  With whisky being in the name of the place, one would think there would be a plethora of whisky. Incidentally, I didn't see anything river-themed, but I suppose there's a story behind the name (I think Dale Earnhardt Jr. owns these restaurants...so maybe the name has something to do with him).   All in all, not a terrible place, just not one that I would plan to go back to should I find myself on a layover in CLT again.

NeXIxuTM4q10VFE5w8N9gA.text: It's an airport restaurant. I was told it was voted favorite airport restaurant but I've had better. The live music wasn't all that good. The patty melt was the smallest I'd ever seen and was served on a huge empty plate. Service was fine but I wouldn't waste my time there again.

2l-keiKSbTd9YfXmHIdo6Q.text: This is an airport restaraunt, which normally would mean the best they could do was a three. But, I was seated quickly on a busy day, my server was friendly, I got served fast, and the food was very good, especially for airport food. I hate long layovers but my experience and the live music made my day better. Thanks!

k6KhJWiwGhPLu43f4DhQrQ.text: Here's how I look at it - it's 4 stars for airport dining. Should I compare it to dining out in the real world where a bottle of water isn't $5?  Or should I compare it to the fare located in this locked down area?  You know, like prison food. Do you think prisons compare it to food on the outside or to other facilities?  So this was a good salad. Probably small for some people but it was perfect for lunch. Salad and two Diet Cokes were $17. That's a total bargain in and out of an airport. The chicken definitely tasted buffaloie (saying it tasted like buffalo sends the wrong message - you get my point though: you could tell it was buffalo but my mouth is not on fire) and the veggies seemed fresh and clean. No brown lettuce. Waitress was nice. And I was in and out in about half an hour.  My personal rule for dining in any airport where there's a waitress is to have an hour between then and my flight. Anything less you're worried the kitchen may be too slow when it's really just on Reginald outside the airport timing.   Whiskey River is in Terminal E and once you get her you may not be up for traveling back to another Terminal. If you come in something else it always seems like E is the farthest away. It is the only place to dine currently in E with wait staff which to me usually means the only place you can grab a drink.   Cheers.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo Chicken Wedge salad (no blue cheese crumbles)
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer on tap

zwXJlBuQlMbL5uKcdFDWqg.text: If you happen to be in Terminal E of the Charlotte Airport and have over an hour to kill before your next flight departs, I would recommend visiting this spot for a quick bite to eat and a thirst quenching beverage.   There really isn't that much on the menu when compared to the stand alone franchise but it is enough to tide you over until you get where you are going. The only set back here is finding a seat and hoping you could eat and drink before your flight gets ready to depart.   This is my second time dining here and both times have been a good experience.

PYxc95FPT9okxGkIGxJD_A.text: Sloppiest burger I've ever ate in my entire life.  Would not recommend to eat food here,but maybe have a beer.  Kitchen is no good!

GzjDb3_67idHoUIGtOcsew.text: Stopped by this place yesterday heading back home. It was pretty packed (which was a good sign) so I decided to check it out. The staff was super helpful and provided great customer service. The overall vibe was so relaxing-not to mention the live music! The menu had a nice selection as well. I'd definitely eat there again if I'm ever in Charlotte

9_YMYOEXlj1t73spjGHwew.text: We had honey bourbon wings and traditional wings. Both were ok. Our waiter Anthony was amazing! He has a great personality. Refreshing experience having someone with such an up beat and happy demeanor. Traveling can be stressful and he was everything but. He was joking and laughing with us...we even caught a little dance. Great service with a smile! Anthony you will give us something good to remember of the Charlotte airport!

vFLV2OXfEo1Bzbq-HSZVEA.text: A solid airport bar. It was clear that they had a handful of regulars so that's reassuring as well. I had a good experience and a great veggie burger with tots. Their menu has good variety and pricing isn't crazy like some airport restaurants. I would definitely go back and suggest it if you have 30+ minutes before your flight starts boarding.

EiIANsDQtVY3xMw3m1F2Xw.text: So I probably should have looked at the Yelp reviews before I decided to eat here.  Since we live in the Charlotte area we don't typically eat at the airport, and as we were transferring from one flight to another flight to visit more of our family we opted for this restaurant since it was close to our departure gate.  Big mistake!  First off make sure you have plenty of time to hang around, it's a long wait to get your food and if you have less than 45 minutes between flights do not order any food.  If you just want to hang out and drink and listen to the live music it's actually a good choice, the guitar player was really good.  We ordered the smothered chicken, the salmon and the wings.  We were told that the delay was due to my chicken, and when we realized we didn't have enough time we explained to the server that our flight boarded in ten minutes and asked for our food to go.  Our server greeted us with a look of indifference that  led me to believe that we were the only people that ever had to ask for our food to go.  That being said, we packed up our stuff, were handed the three styrofoam cartons and pointed to the lady at the front desk who was the keeper of the to go bags and silverware.  She was equally unfriendly.  We headed to our flight, opened up the styrofoam containers and began to eat our chewy salmon and chicken (it was a battle with the plastic knife and fork but I eventually won it!) and the cold fries.  So given that I was told we had to wait for my chicken I would have thought the fries would be warm?  So here's what I think.  Backed up/poorly organized kitchen, needed an excuse so they blamed it on my chicken and when I called on it they did all they could think of in terms of blowing us off.  I did tip the server 15%, although my wife challenged me as to why I did that, and I assumed it was the kitchen.  I'm not so sure now.  There are so many better places in the Charlotte airport, I would encourage you to skip this one and try something else.

X9pBpujfMlGXUcCeeXa0Cw.text: Okay so just ate lunch here and quite honestly I wasn't impressed. Overpriced bar food.  I got a quesadilla which was tasty and full but not priceworthy. They charge 2 dollars for a scoop of guacamole and these potatoes were called brava black potatoes which sounded unique but were nothing more than fried fingerling potatoes. The broccoli was nice.  The service stunk to be honest and they don't have to go cups for tee thumbs down

-0Bvh6nrp88uyeKID8Nm6g.text: Just 2 stars for the food...which is the most important thing about a restaurant, right? Lively atmosphere...great place to grab a drink or catch the game between flights. The waiter seated the 3 of us at a table for 6. Then later seated a lady with us who was dining alone. Made for an awkward dining experience for us all!

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great place to catch the game between flights. Food was...meh and a bit pricey for the taste. Ood music and lively atmosphere!

HsFD7SegLgHjmRg4ykXI6A.text: Food was fresh and well prepared. A hearty meal.  Service was typical airport service.  Slow to respond, little attention. If this were more festive, it would be a welcoming place to sit for a while.

WVpqmW3-qt4lcgTPHyek_A.text: As far as airport food goes, Whiskey River is better than most. I always get the Carolina Cobb salad and have not had any issues with the quality.  They always seem to be short staffed, or the hostess fails to tell the server they have sat guests in their section.  This trips service was better than normal.  They seem to be trying to rectifying this situation with the at table call buttons.  I didn't need to use the call button on this visit. Let's hope I won't need to use it in the future either.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

zS8q5fUnkr1xBhx36ynQsA.text: Decent spot to grab a bite to eat in the Charlotte airport. We had pickle chips, and chicken fingers. We also enjoyed beer and wine. I had wanted a glass of rose, but they were out of both! I guess I shouldn't expect "Whiskey River" to have a large wine selection. I enjoyed a glass of sparkling, and everyone else had beer. The service was good especially being in an airport! They got us in and out quickly in time for our flight.

RZmMQ1XLRTSchCSP_2YSPA.text: Man. The service is slow. Slooooowwwww. Like 20 minutes to get a seat at a table with four strangers. Then 20 minutes to order a drink. Then 20 minutes to get said drink. The food is average at best and the prices are high. The best part of the experience was listening to the life story of 87 year old man at my table. If this wasn't the only sit down restaurant on the E gates of CLT, they'd be out of business.

SL5MBfwsymVZnoEXIBQ0Ow.text: Definition of 1 Star establishment. Monopoly as they're the only bar at this portion of airport except a few carts further down towards gates. Annoying Hispanic hostess (the grown up Napoleon Dynamite dude with an attitude)  screaming at clients on where to sit, overpriced drinks, bar is uncomfortable. Ask them to change the channel? think you'd asked for a blood transfusion. Food is terrible- even fried chicken. Music is loud, opposite of what you're looking for in an airport bar and finding plugs for phone is a challenge. The worst airport bar I've ever seen. Fix it!

jpvvaDHtjP8K1mDMruDuOQ.text: Despite having a large and nearby service area, two of the wait staff opted to use my table to discuss their shifts and fill out paperwork. I was less than a foot away from the woman leaning against my table. At no point did she acknowledge my presence nor apologize for using my table as a working space. This is an airport restaurant so my expectations were low, but wow. Grab some food at the nearby Market and skip this overpriced spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

loWh8XhRRFe8MjOlV5qvjg.text: Typical airport restaurant with typical airport quality food: overpriced and not very good.   The things on the menu here sound like they'd be pretty good if you were dining at one of the Whisky Rivers outside the airport  but here, it's just bland.   The reason I came here is because I wanted to watch the NASCAR race while waiting on my plane and since it's owned by Dale Earnhardt Jr., I thought it would be good.   Ordered a burger and it was nothing to write home about. Not bad but definitely not good. No spices, no pizazz, no nothing.   Last, but not least, the pricing. Ain't it amazing that one of his other restaurants in downtown Charlotte, this meal is around $10.99 but at the airport, it's $15.99.   Not complaining too much about airport prices because I'm used to it. Trap a passenger inside when they're hungry and they'll pay any price.   But they could do a little more to improve the taste and service.

Z8yHIrxs6HYk4SvaC2YZ_Q.text: I am giving this place a four because the service was just fantastic. This place is busy, and with all the people who stop here while traveling, the servers stay personable and the service was fast! Which is great, because we are in an airport, trying to catch a flight...you know you can grab a cocktail and dinner and not miss you flight. Lol.   As far as the food.....eh. Not super flavorful. I had a pulled pork sandwich which should have amazing flavor...was kind of bland. But it came out hot and fast....and I'm in an airport...so, can't really complain. If your expectations at an airport restaurant is high, you need to re-evaluate your standards or don't ever eat at a restaurant in an airport. Lol.   And hey, they got live music here too which is nice. So yeah, got a few hours while laying over for your next flight...I'd come here again to mellow out, enjoy a good drink, decent food, and a nice ambiance while I wait...

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hendricks &amp; tonic. Cucumber on the side...

dixgUHh4_tLTC8dyj95ehg.text: Do I eat breakfast here all the time. All I can say is that Dale Jr has retired, so he needs to crank out the revenue by keeping the prices up ans staffing low. With high turnover in an airport place, you need to staff it right. Dont sit down if you are going to be in a hurry. Beer selection was great. Watched two folks wait on their check for way too long. My Texas Club sandwich tasted alright...kind of small for $13, but hey, its an airport. Tater tots...barely hot. If you are a savvy traveller and can roll with the puncges, not a bad place. And by the way Breakfast is SOLID. Have eaten here at least a handful of times prior to an early flight. Cheers and good travels!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

VDW_VdjF9MjCVJfdz5hNzw.text: Over priced drinks and over priced food...top it off with sub par service and you will have a very uneventful time. A drink was made improperly and when my girlfriend asked for it to be corrected the bartender acted like she spit in her face. Save your money...go to Burger King.

pcOzkmYY_JLNMs1kDLAjXA.text: I fly through Charlotte often on my way to and from DC.  If I have enough time on my layover, I will stop at Whiskey River for a bite to eat.  Great food!  If you like BBQ this is the place to go.  The service has been good every time, as long as you account for a longer than normal wait due to the crowd and number of single tabs that the wait staff has to handle.  The live entertainment acts are a plus, especially if you catch a hidden gem!

F8IipQL1Fiq7Oftpi_ETFg.text: Horrible service. The waitress didn't even look at me while taking my order and came back three times to repeatedly ask me what side I wanted with my burger. She then threw the utensils at the table. I'd rather be eating cold boxed meals in a fox hole in the Middle East than here. Send me back, now.

5tUSUdZpB5BYhtbKvXbYwA.text: So disappointed, I love dale Jr and wanted to support him but the drinks were undrinkable and the food was disgusting

8M1InmN2nhRfXNCWokbuhQ.text: For the record, I'm not one to typically complain. I usually just let go of things and move on, but I feel the need to warn all who may go here! I was seated very quickly (granted, I was by myself) while I waited for what ended up being 3 canceled AA flights- joy. My server was fast, but not very friendly (was a shorter man of Asian descent probably in his 40's). I felt as if I was a burden to him simply by being present.  I got my meal (smothered chicken) after about 20 mins, but it was cold and seemed as if it'd been sitting under a heat lamp for quite some time. The chicken was mediocre. The BBQ sauce had begun to thicken by the time I got it, though, like it does when it sits out for a long time. While the fries were well seasoned, they were mostly soggy. But I was so hungry at the time, it didn't matter much to me (at least not until my stomach was tore up later!).   I also ordered their version of a margarita (which evidently is $17 and costed more than my meal, and, shocker, the prices aren't listed on the menu so you're in for a good surprise if you get an alcoholic beverage), and it tasted terrible. I can usually get a poor tasting drink down, but this one I couldn't manage taking more than two swigs from. It didn't even taste like it should have. Pretty positive it was a glass full of just straight sour mix. I drink LIT's often, so I can tell when someone has a heavy hand with the sour mix. This was FAR beyond a heavy hand with the sour mix. Made me want to puke.   Anyway, when I asked my waiter to take the $17 drink off my receipt, he was pretty rude about it. I drank my whole glass of water but only two sips from the margarita. It's obvious it wasn't good, but he acted as if I was trying to just get out of paying for it, though clearly that was not the case! He reluctantly took it off the receipt but copped a tude about it. Said I should have known it was going to be that expensive. Though, regardless, it was pure shit. If it had been delicious, I'd have gladly coughed up the money for it and even gotten another considering how my day had been going thus far.   So- service was fast, but everything else was sub par to terrible. The live music was good, however! But the waiter was a dick.

ozj3Tuifb9IBE0O4j_lkUA.text: It shouldn't take this long for anything at an airport but at Whisky River it does. More than ten minutes of queue to get a seat in the "outside" area, which seemed to be due to only having a single host working the stand. His side job of wiping menus took up much of his time. At this point, I really just wanted to see how long it would take.  Dale Jr. needs to get his pit crew working on expediting things here.  Located halfway up the E concourse where the regional jets and the prop planes park.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dale Earnhardt&#39;s Whisky River in the CLT airport

MS3dSR2UC_W_AszpNxuU7Q.text: I struggled writing this review. While, the food was delicious (my husband and I got the tequila burger) the service was abismal.   It took forever to get our drinks and all we asked for was water. Once our order was placed we again waited for an extraordinary length of time. While we finished our food not once did our waitress come back and check on us or offer to refill our drinks. One of the waitresses was more interested in taking snaps by the bar then serving her customers in the not overly crowded restaurant.   If you're looking for a place to kill a long layover this place will definitely fulfill your needs as you will be here for over 2 hours. If however you're looking to make a tight connection your better off hitting up another joint.

LZ5xVYYB8re2StjWkcBPDg.text: Came here for lunch while in transit.  I am not sure what I expected but it wasn't good at all.  I had the mushroom Swiss burger as it was the only thing wasn't smothered with something.    I am not looking for exceptional gourmet but better than what I got.   The service was really good so that is why I gave the rating I did.    I would not repeat.

dEB4RGjq7jh20fIRXYmR4Q.text: Food was good but ask the price for the wine . Outrageous prices $23 per 9 oz. Glasses of wine . Are you f in kidding me

tIkV5UvfN63WQdmjPfcICg.text: I travel quite often for work and have not been to the Charlotte airport I a while. My server, Yolanda, was just SUPERB!!! I was traveling alone so she made me feel right at home and knew exactly what to pin point on the menu. As a previous server myself in Boston, her service was exceptional so yes she deserves a huge shoutout and a 5/5 stars.

ik686x0xrQ4D6Z3in8SjnA.text: In the Raleigh airport, traveling for work - a group of 7 restaurant managers from a national chain. Asked to be seated, it was busy so we were willing to wait. Hostess was a bit rude to us, but we were hungry. Manager came out and told us we couldn't all sit together. We told him we were fine waiting, then no one ever came and checked with us again. We ate somewhere else then came back to get drinks. There were only 6 seats at the bar so we grabbed a chair from a nearby EMPTY table. The bartender told us that was absolutely not allowed. We asked for the manager(same toothless guy as before) who basically told us they were only allowed to have a certain number of seats at the bar. I just don't understand what kind of customer service this is?? I will tell everyone i come in contact with to NEVER spend money at Whiskey River!!!

tz3zElIc0VMiYx8FBCOr4A.text: This site is a one-two-punch when it comes to service, entertainment and great food! Can't say enough about, esp since the server is the catalyst for an ideal dining experience. Such is True for me days ago.  KELLI is T H E  B E S T . . . for top-flight service from prompt, efficient and congenial service to large, plump chicken wings, seasoned beyond expectations. I can't say enough about Kelli - her smile, cordiality and ahead-of-the-ape-ball timing. Extra napkins on the table early on without me asking, timely refills on drink, clean/beautiful grooming and a one million dollar smile - all the ingredients that welcome and sustain a weary traveler.   The tall, blonde, female singer was easy on the ears that became medicine to my soul after a long day w clients. The music, food and server was a cocktail for gratification, especially in a busy airport.  Thanks to all staff for such an uplifting experience. May your tribes increase!!!

cJjxtVgkFQbIzgUqkIl2TQ.text: I set down here to weather a long layover.  I wasn't overly hungry, so I had the chili.  Setved in a small griddle, it was homemade and good.  The decor was fun.  Now the issues: the chili came with a plastic spoon and no napkin.  When I  made a complaint, the waitress produced a spoon quickly, explaining that wait staff were throwing them away, so they were short!  Second issue: my double bourbon on the rocks was very small, although disguised by the ice.  Ill go elsewhere next time.

dRm9WEXyX9swwVDGW-4Jdw.text: Returning home on Red Eye from Las Vegas... after eating at some of the best- " expensive" restaurants in Vegas.... none of which could serve a boiled or soft scrambled egg half way decent (most of the time they were cold) .... right here in the Charlotte Airport, we had the best scrambled eggs and strawberries on our trip for a fraction of the cost.  First time we have eaten here, we'll try it again.  Our server was attentive and friendly as well.

Ay3vvjFEkOML_pQEnp4pSQ.text: 3.5 stars. I thought the food here was pretty average (I had a pulled pork sandwich). The service, however, was very fast and efficient. I was able to get dinner pretty quickly. I definitely was out of there w/in 30 minutes. Prices are about average for an airport restaurant.   Overall, a decent eating option in terminal E if you have more than an hour layover in Charlotte.

ndDVlHnjp_BXtEpBXMA0xg.text: God awful service. Slow and unacceptable. Bartenders are forgetful and no ESPN on TV. To too it all off,they charged me the wrong tab and when I called them out, all I got was a smile and a "my bad".  So yeah, overall it sucks! I'm so glad I'm never coming here again. F*** places like this.

ym1RGQCLPnc2-fqD0nnjNA.text: It's a Kardashian.  Looks pretty on the outside but nothing to brag about once you had it.  Food was lukewarm and bland.  Waiter had no personality.  I was happy they had a good selection of spirits.  And the food came out fast but that also explains why the food was likewarm.

APxbqZeFLM4fTXQNcWnHbg.text: This place is seriously bad. The food, service, live music and price is a joke. Dale Jr. You should get your people in this. When the best thing I can say is the tater tots aren't too bad, well you get my drift.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

YI0cFBwgN8MXjbKsgzEnJA.text: Wow! What a happy find.  Been awake since 1:30 am flying out of Boston.  Been bouncing around East Coast airports and now I'm here in SC.  Fantastic server recommended a local brew (which I wasn't thrilled about), so I went with a ShockTop.  For breakfast, I had the fried chicken (tenders), on buttermilk biscuits.  You get two w/3 tenders and a side of home fries.  Sooooo good.  Very reasonable prices too for the airport.  Nice whiskey selection as expected.  You got time, stop in.  I'm sure you'll be happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. So good.  It&#39;s 10 am. Got a tall ShockTop and a buttermilk chicken tenders/sausage biscuit.  Ahhhhhhh vacation.
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. My 10 am Shocktop against the wall of buckles.
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken tenders on a buttermilk biscuit with potatoes.

_Hdn-vNznX98gw4UKb-wUg.text: Garbage food, garbage service.  BBQ sauce tested like ketchup.  Lettuce was brown.  Chicken was frozen.  Spend 2hrs here, saw the waitress 3 times.  She was oblivious.  Set down salads with no forks, we had to get forks ourselves.  Beer tasted soapy.

xz8z-T67Yf0AxB9KE11-Hg.text: I stopped by Whiskey River while traveling today.  The place is packed, it seems everyone is looking for a place to sit and grab a bite this afternoon.  I ordered the boneless buffalo wings and I waited and I waited. 30 minutes later my wings arrived.  I took my first bite only to find them cold to the touch.  I wasn't really surprised as it had taken so long to get them.  I mentioned to the waitress they were cold and she asked if I wanted her to bring me some more. I declined telling her I didn't have much time.  Five minutes later she presented me with a fresh plate of hot boneless buffalo wings.  They were hot in temperature and hot in flavor.  Customer service really turned this visit around.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Boneless Buffalo Wings

_UKZiMxdGy7H4Li6WgH0LQ.text: Ok first off this is an Airport Restaurant. And I'm rating it accordingly. Lots of sports TVs. Music Loud enough that u have. To raise your voice. Service is friendly and fast. The menu is pricey for what they are offering but my pulled pork sandwich ($12.99) plus side salad ($2.99) was good. Definitely Western Carolina BBQ served with cole slaw and pickles on Texas toast. The $8.99 Chardonnay would have been a good deal at $7 buy the portion was generous. I'd eat here again if I got trapped on a layover on concourse E.

oH8QkEHg0RvJnSsu0CrAcA.text: Stopped here early in the morning on a Tuesday to chill on a layover.  I was lucky to have this establishment near my gate (E9). Wasn't really feeling a cocktail but then I saw it - the Moonshine Mary. Bartenders description was "it ain't Grandpappy's Moonshine, but it hits the spot!" Damn right it hit the spot - I'm a new fan of Moonshine Mary's! Three drinks later I was nicely lathered up for my next flight! This wouldn't of been possible without Brad the Bartender behind the wheel. Worth stopping by!

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Impressive cocktail menu

9gBIwHDmYZNOdvF0gMdtEA.text: We were starving.  There was no hostess. We sat ourselves at the bar.  We were hurried into making a order. The drinks were way overpriced at $19 for a margarita which wasn't even on the menus.  The bartender was rude. Will not eat there again. Two couples that are there also that night said they won't eat there again.

9cIaTP17ttrPy8uDqXeE7A.text: Arrived at 830 with a 2hr layover and decided to get brunch or regular breakfast since it was a Sunday. Well FAT chance of getting a mimosa or any alcoholic beverage.  They serve alcohol after 12 noon. Our waiter was rude about it after I said that's all I really wanted for breakfast.  We went ahead and ordered breakfast. I got the classic breakfast with 2 eggs your way. I asked to have them poached, the waitress laughed  .....and said either fried or scrambled.  Why advertise your way if it's only prepared two ways.  My husband got the large breakfast which was just like mine except they put 4 tbs of grits under his eggs, oh did I mention they only serve cold white un_toasted toast

3gS4KC9HVITL6gp-wA8GkA.text: This place was better than I expected. Seating is tight since airports haven't figured out how to make space for carry on baggage..... I mean it doesn't take a genius. I was going for something lighter so I got the Cobb salad. It was VERY good and packed with meats! I heard the lady next to me who ordered chili say it was tasteless but the salad was ok!

MIdCoyQ_CwZVIeOzZrpImQ.text: Had a 3 hr layover so I decided to stop for a sit down meal.   I had a burger with fries and a glass of wine.  Surprisingly, it didn't set me back too much.  The food was very good and Daniel, my server was great.  This was my first visit here, but I fly through Charlotte frequently and this won't be my last.

5ccJvP9my1geDclsOtSHQA.text: This was a quick stop before boarding our 7 hour flight. The place was packed but we managed to grab two seats at a high top communal table.   Our server was with us in a minute, delivered drinks promptly and our sandwiches shortly thereafter. My grilled chicken sandwich was AOK.   This is not fine dining but was great for a drink, and a bite while seated. It IS in the airport, so it's loud, busy and needs to be treated in a category of its own.   The terminal could use a bigger bathroom (there is none in the restaurant) and the menu could use a couple of healthier choices...but we got what we needed and moved on! Cheers!

uVlwe2FmPvNvTfxHCYxXKw.text: I missed this place the last time I passed thru Charlotte airport at 6:30a. I'm glad I had the opportunity to come again. I ordered the Chipotle Burger and BBQ fries. Albeit the burger was small, it was good and cooked as ordered. The beer choice was a healthy Porter which I enjoyed a lot aside the he $10 price... hey, it's in an airport... what do you expect. All-in-all, it was an expensive small burger but the atmosphere was good and so was the beer. With that, I'll give it 4-stars. Not a great home run but a bit better that just okay for an airport lunch.

QV4I5mCpQLMx57OpkEGNkg.text: I mean it's still rushed airport food. The cooks will always have  a non-stop stream of orders, restaurant will always be capacity. That being said, not a bad meal.  Good service. I fly through Charlotte alot so I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon chicken, cheddar. Not terrible.

J5RIIyhU4iUPEWVeaOahMA.text: A breakfast sandwich took an hour and wasn't as requested.  Service was cold but not rude.  It's in the airport and do with it what you want.

8rYix1wmul-q8x8nNdv1pQ.text: It worth the time or $$.  Ordered nachos, greatly disappointed. All the cheese was on the bottom of the plate, virtually none on any of the chips. The brisket was like shredded jerky - incredibly dry and tasteless. Service and wait time for for the food was slow, especially considering how empty the place was.  Do yourself a favor and skip this place.

TzID36vj0hRWdmv1fQN0Gg.text: Apparently it is standard for this place to pour a double if you are getting a 16oz drink such as a Bloody Mary.  Be ready to pay $17 for a "bottom shelf" bloody mary! I get it, we are in an airport, but i'm sorry, this is not okay.   For the Mgmt. If I wanted a double,  I would have asked for it. As a consumer, I shouldn't walk out feeling the way I do right now (as though I went out on the town). It is not advertised and the bartender definitely did not ask me if it's what I wanted. I feel like was taken advantage of.

CrSfnUPVACeHZCioi5WCfA.text: If you want a quick lunch between flights this place will work okay.  But be aware that a draft of Bud Light will cost you $9,  the food is marginally acceptable, tables are all crammed together, and service is slow.

Vd2Ar-H4XlSczwiUkpt4Vw.text: I'm surprised by the lower star reviews. I thought this place was great. The service was good. Had a mushroom and Swiss burger and fries.  Good burger but the fries were amazing. Never had fries like these before.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

8iIl-_L33b5qNUlZdkBNsw.text: A 2 egg breakfast is the easy choice when having woken at 5AM as well as the most reasonably priced.  This seemed to be the consensus since this is what others were opting for as well.  Breakfast was pretty standard.  Service for the # of staff to patrons was pretty sluggish.  Not a bad choice for a standard 2-3 egg when you're heading to the end of Terminal E.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Classic Breakfast

v0qdg_w6x3WHrMAvhJSGJw.text: Had a layover in Charlotte airport, so we tried Whisky River for lunch.  We both had salads and I have to say the portions were big!  I couldn't finish my Chicken Caesar!  The only thing I didn't like is there were no croutons :(   And the dressing was definitely all at the bottom of the bowl.  Not a deal breaker though as it was still a tasty salad!  What I liked:  There was a device on the table where you could press buttons to summon your service, pay, or cancel the order.  The servers all had devices on their wrists (like a watch) so that they could attend to the tables.  Good to have when you need to get in and out quick!  I mean who wants to miss their flight over a lunch??    All in all not a bad place to hang out for a few.  (Yes, there is a bar there too!)

uCrJP0Mx_Z-Io3q0eoJFqw.text: Y'all are a shit show. The worst service and airport restaurant ever. You have the most unfriendly server with blonde hair I have ever met in my entire life. Literally just mean. Not one of your servers help each other out! I watched my made bar drink sit in the well for 10 plus (no joke) minutes while all the other servers grabbed their tickets and their drinks. Will make sure to walk past this place on my next connection for sure. Best of luck here ! Terrible

5nOHEdMZkf4cTO8MNlKcuw.text: Live cowboy playing in this place. I chose here because he was really good. Tequila burger was awesome. Fries were very good! good selection of beer, and i got a porter which was great. First time in this airport so i don't know often live music is here, but i'd definitely come if he is playing.

f_fiuAmUyeu3niafsxlUbQ.text: I think it's the most popular and perhaps the best restaurant in the airport.  I've eaten and had drinks here a few times and enjoyed it each time. It's always busy at this location.  The food servers are very friendly and attentive to your needs.  The food is good and the beer is cold. You really can't ask for more than that when traveling through the airports of America. There are often limited choices and lack of ambience but this place has it all. Check them out the next time you travel through Charlotte NC.

Aa213CK18q5KMux5szIx9g.text: I happened to be walking by and decided to try it. Excellent Low Country Boy Burger. As for price? It's an airport. But well worth it

P85dLidgazAMdZCkvpJ_9Q.text: Server was cocky and rude. Ice tea was fresh brewed. Chicken tenders were dry; and portion small. House Caesar salad was the usual. The Bourbon honey sauce was really good.

3AaHBNtwuskvB56BBpKE1Q.text: If you have ever asked if quality barbecue could be served in an airport restaurant, look no further. You know you're on to something when you round the corner and a wall full of belt buckles awaits you. Then you look at the menu and realize all of the usual items await; brisket, pulled pork, slaw, banana pudding. I went with the pulled pork (comes with slaw AND a side) plate. For $12, I was even more surprised. When I asked what was on tap, I was told about German mead. I had to try it at least once (actually, twice).       The hostess and waitress were friendly and the order was out fairly quick. If you are seated in just the right spot, you almost forget you're at a airport. The live music helped with that. I will be sure to visit the second location (in Charlotte) if I am ever in town for a day.  *Insider's Tip -Seating is basically "fill a empty chair". If there's one beside you, then expect company. If you have a personal space bubble, either have a couple of friends with you or pick another spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. No better way to fly the skies, friendly.
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

Mc_2Xh7I27VgEO-YjFj1bw.text: Food was good Recommendations based on guest needs, were great! SERVICE AT THE BAR WAS OUTSTANDING. I would highly recommend...and will go back. Bartenders were more than happy to change channels and accommodate media requests.  Tarot tots were ridiculous. If not health conscious...GET THEM!! So good!!

AWEy5Q6CsMVlGpjMUZmQJA.text: The peach crumble would be awesome with ice cream, but out of season not quite sweet peaches ruin it. And they have no ice cream. Maybe a little brown sugar would help? Don't know just saying. Snickers pie was very good.

G-hVIVvCt_Z7FqfQVPRuGw.text: Ever so often you get a airport restaurant that takes time to help the veggie eaters.  Whiskey river has an amazing Chipotle burger with the option of a veggie Patty and barbecue fries.  Awesome combination.  Yolanda was the server and Cathy the host ! Both were great !!   Will surely drop in next time I'm flying by CLT (_)

zQnVdqzmJEXEpAU9CdOj2w.text: This airport restaurant was a great brunch stop while waiting to board our plane! The cocktails were a bit pricey but delicious. The bartenders were very nice and attentive. Food was delicious and reasonably priced. The restaurant has a nice appearance. Good selection of whiskey and bourbon.

jofiv6BAyMAtBBdIby9eNQ.text: Edwin was a great server despite the poor hostess team. Food good despite few garnishments.

ZZ28bwHn0hl3s9Ci4Fm6JQ.text: The cocktails are terrible and cost a fortune even though they don't put the prices on the menu. The food is mediocre at best. I had the Buffalo shrimp. It was a sad meal.

B8JOxmZo8xkaQRAbWKwX7A.text: My wife and I stopped in because it smelled good. We were seated quickly and the waitress took our order. Food was ok but not great. The staff and the waitress was not very nice

htBoJIKedmb3ghL49nEp9w.text: I didn't read any of the other reviews before deciding to try this place for the first time. I have been coming through Charlotte for years and was sad to see the old restaurant replaced by Whiskey River.  I knew several of the wait staff and they were my breakfast place because of the prompt service.  Tonight I had some time because of a long layover, so I gave the place a try. Service was just fine. The menu is not that broad, but just fine for airport food. This is the place to get a solid meal and be able to watch the game. There are enough TV's for everyone. I don't drink, so someone else will have to tell you about the beer selection. The salmon was good.

wIX2JPU3jLsJJhvh66kN9A.text: Can't complain, despite the other low reviews, my service at the bar was outstanding. Cobb salad was good as well.

bNY1XLuevgMyBWJFlKQJSw.text: The black and blue burger with slaw was good. I liked the burger flavor, fresh beef, not frozen patties. Slaw was genorus and ok. End of lunch hour so service was good. Guy next to waited forever, choked down food and ran. So mixed food timing. Prices airport prices, burger, slaw soda and 18.00, but sit down and good , if you have time.

Y1JvmXqvvondauWhXiWLVQ.text: Food is very average airport restaurant food. Prices are expectedly high, especially the beer. Gave it 3 stars for the very enjoyable live music. First time for that an airport bar/restaurant.

MndmuhmYhMyFudrMTkuSIQ.text: I'm a big cheese grits fan so when I saw stone ground cheddar grits as part of the Big Country breakfast at Whiskey River at the Charlotte Airport, I knew that was happening :)   The breakfast platter came with extra crispy (as requested!) bacon, ribbon sheets of delicious scrambled eggs atop killer cheese grits with a soft, freshly baked biscuit dredged in a delightful jalapeno-infused honey. It had all of the flavor and not too much spice. The biscuit soaked up the honey like a good bread pudding.   Jennifer was an excellent server and made sure everything was cooked as I ordered it. Chef Carlos knows how to make some serious scrambled eggs and I love love love the texture, cheesiness and creaminess struck the perfect balance for me. I may just have to come back here during my next layover :)

ALOY33tsT8CkL6LA_QmVJQ.text: ate at the one in the CLT airport. Wasn't too bad. The air wasn't really working that great, but there was a spot for me to plug in my phone for a charge. Get the Nachos and the Salmon.

Kvy7B4GLQmd53mM9lDWW5Q.text: Sandwich was tasty but cold and while the fries were on the minute as "bbq" they  were plain fries and cold. I don't ever hold out high hopes for airport food but this was the worse and the service was horrible and not even at the height of normal rush hours

wyqQ0wUKpECcUnI_fs4kFw.text: If there was a half star or no star rating this place would get it. Waited at the hostess station for about 10 minutes while three waitresses stood and talked. Finally got a salad because you don't have to cook it and it should be fast. Contacted a different waiter because my waitress was kidnapped by space ninjas. She was 3 time hide and seek of the Eastern US. Manager never showed up... Went to the bar and asked again for a manager. Miraculously my salad shows up after at least 40 minutes. Never once got a refill. This place has good food. The service is a joke and that is being very nice. I work here along with many other international airports. You will never get a good recommendation until the service staff improves. .0000001 stars

3c7_A60QTk7f_kLJkoLG1w.text: Service was slow and don't bother with the Cobb salad.  Lunch meat, lettuce that was cut far too big,egg and bacon portion was limited and no trace of cheese.  Hostesses too busy chatting to seat anyone on a timely basis

zU_lguo_PWlZGdeYubVeQQ.text: I didn't make it past the hostess stand at this joke of a restaurant. On a layover I decided on a sit-down meal. The hostess asked my name and I gave it to her despite at least 8 open tables I could see. Another gentleman checked in behind me and we proceeded to stand there for 10 minutes as other guests left and vacated more tables. Finally the hostess asked, do you want a table? I said, I thought that's why I was standing here. She said, do you two mind sharing a table? I said, why, you have at least 10 tables open. She said but those are 4 tops. Now I frequent airports every week and have never been not given an empty table. Ridiculous!!!!

9O2SIkIOAY8qoyKwdXvkng.text: I would probably like to either eat here or have a beer, but I'll never know. The bar was full and the bartender ignored me when I stood at the bar. Then I went and waited in line at the host/horses station and the guy asked where I wanted to sit. I told him that all I wanted was a beer and wanted to get one then. He said he'd seat me by the bull and a server would help me so I told him I didn't have time to wait on a server but wanted to get a beer and pay for it then. He mumbled something unintelligible and took the guy behind me. So they can pound sand I won't be going there ever again.

t6h33MXPDFQzakL2aCrytg.text: The food was OK, nothing fancy, but not bad. The service was very slow, and I didn't even get my drink until well after my meal had come. I did not get much attention from the waitstaff.

iB0xlrxcIUtcD4NPsYwI_Q.text: Nice bar but needs bigger tvs in bar area.  Good service.  Plugs right at the bar is a super idea.

y8WAeAj9Jso3hCChWKHQmw.text: I'm genuinely confused about their business model. This restaurant is at an airport. I was traveling alone, and I was asked if I'd sit at a shared table, and I readily agreed. I told the hostess that I needed to catch a flight, and I asked her about the fastest item on the menu. When the waitress came to get the drink order, I asked for "Water, please, and the fastest item on the menu: the pulled pork sandwich." She smiled, nodded, collected the menu and a few minutes later brought the water. After 35 minutes, I realized that I'd have less than 5 minutes to wolf down a sandwich that arrived now. The man next to me received his food and I asked him how long between ordering and receiving food; 45 minutes, he said. I had to leave. Now here is the crazy thing... I eat at a lotta bbq joints, some are literally twice as busy as this place, and a pulled pork sandwich typically take FIVE minutes. This place here is at an airport, for goodness sake. Get your act together. Zero stars, but cannot post with less than one.

xgFVNQCYc6hgho-hzPWyOA.text: Our waitress, Chanel clearly wasn't listening as we placed the order. As soon as she walked away from our table, I told my friend our food would not be right. BINGO - she brought fries when my friend said "no fries". Her burger was dry and inedible. I ordered a black and blue burger with a veggie patty substitute and I got a mushroom and Swiss burger. Wait?? WHAT??? There was some slight empathy from the waitress but it didn't feel very genuine. I'm sitting here now waiting for her to offer to bring my bill. Tick tick!!! I think she accidentally asked once if we needed anything else but she hasn't been back since.  Update - Chanel is getting ready to clock out soon so she's going around asking people to settle their bills now before she goes. Good thing it's all about her. Good riddance! Awful food, slow waitress and apathetic customer service. Run run far away from Whisky River in CLT!!!

slG7AedOV4Gvi7nPUp1WAw.text: We stopped in Whiskey River for a quick bite between flights. The restaurant was uncomfortably warm which might have been  the reason the wait staff was less than pleasant. They were all 'sit down and don't bother me' from the moment we walked in. When they brought something to the table, there was little if any eye contact and none of the typical small talk you usually get from the waitress. We watched her clean multiple tables while our drinks sat at the bar getting warm even though we had mentioned that our flight was not too far out and so we were In a bit of a hurry. My wife got the brisket quesadillas which were great. I got the buffalo chicken wrap with tots. Unfortunately the ONLY thing I could taste in mine was the buffalo sauce, and the tots were overcooked and cold. When I told the manager about it, they swapped my dish for quesadillas and after that the waitress warmed up a bit... but next time I am in the Charlotte airport, I will taxie on by Whiskey River.

OcOubSCNX0JP7vQZPyexlQ.text: Very disappointing! Took 25 min to get a salad and grilled cheese. Salad had about a bottle of dressing on it, and the grilled cheese was soggy and cold. Asked for slaw, got Tater tots. Will never eat here again. I'm a big Junior fan but this sucked.

i6nk6R4w9BV6SrIh8Nrb0Q.text: This is in the airport. The place was packed and I saw two servers. The one I had was rude and inattentive, probably because of the situation the management set him up with. The manager came to speak with me, and given his snotty attitude, I have nothing nice to say. This place is severely mismanaged. I don't recommend stopping here unless you have at least 90 minutes to kill. Steer clear.

31F0DO9BzXvyxfd894ceDA.text: Service and atmosphere was good. Food was average. Prices were okay for a sit down airport restaurant. We wouldn't hesitate to stop here for a meal of we had a layover and were hungry.

ieboWZ4VcMfW_llFeCKVgA.text: Bad airport food. Who runs out of pancakes in the early morning? Flimsy dry over cooked omelet and gotta say it was the worst omelet I ever had in my life.

wrM2TStSwjqAXj23PVb6Cg.text: What a treat! Live music at an airport bar on a Tuesday afternoon. Great service and lots of places to charge your phone if necessary  (perfect for layovers).

Yz0R3Vki-G6PR25ii653Fw.text: Airport service is usually bad. This place is awful. Had a great beer though. But in an hour 15 min got one beer. I guess they saved me some money!

s0t_O4fHi_Mntauzh8N7EA.text: Horrible bartender chick! Took some dudes order who walked up when I'd been sitting there 5 minutes!

vCiA3jvhe1dN2FuyIJ6d7Q.text: Food ok.  Server was a bit grouchy.  Had an early flight. They were not open. We asked when they openef and were told 6 am. They were put off when we pointed out it was after 6.  Then had to wait longer because our server was telling jokes with a coworker.  A different server pointed out she had people in her section.    Breakfast omelet was fair at best.

CurfwoLEIPK5m7JJo1NSkA.text: Appetizer and a cocktail $32.00. I guess to be expected with airport food... Only way I'd return is if I was stuck in Terminal E again

qVncYlpuW4QhwaegmxQTHQ.text: My favorite spot to come to in the Epicenter. Love the diversity. Great space and great party.

x0mJk37ckKAlWU02mSbglw.text: Came here while waiting to catch a flight . I was seated right away but it took awhile for someone to come take my order and when someone finally and over it wasn't even the waitress in my section. I ordered the Texas club and it was below average. The ham and turkey were a weird texture as it was just very bland. No one checked on me me until they brought my check.  Not impressed, wouldn't recommend eating here .

e-9o6KBeuMldh_H6M0CFUg.text: It's airport food, I get it. But once you've tagged me $10 for a beer, it would be nice - and I don't believe too much to ask - that the chicken be at least slightly more meat than breading. Furthermore, it was done frying about 2 hours ago guys, it's dead, I promise. Finally, cardboard bread is pretty much expected but can we reduce the volume by about 90% so that the sandwich contents can actually be located by my taste buds? Sigh.

JWN1MAMmLHvpebyRbFnWOA.text: Specifically came here for the brisket quesadilla. Never have time due to tight connections, but today flight actually arrived early. Put in the order, closed out tab early to be ready to go after eating. Tab was $9 as the bartender forgot to put the order in...and the $9 relates to a bud light which was also delivered an an afterthought. Left a tip, but I shouldn't have.

algKawXMT5NhH7QmFrA1Qg.text: Excellent service,  excellent food, got the Dirty Tots, great quick bite to eat, BBQ sauce good with a little bite to it. Would definitely go again!

lbw98xqjxnEbFXBax_kPRw.text: The service was horrible. I waited 22 mins just to order my drink. When I stopped two waiters, they stated that that isn't their section. One gentleman saw the frustration on my face, and decided to help me. The food was ok. I ordered the salmon and potatoes. I probably will never return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

erXN9rXh8QHuwTK76ijUqw.text: Don't you dare eat here and not try a local beer. Noda Jam session, jalapeno beer, so many options. If you order a bud, you're missing out. Food served is an excellent option in concourse E.

6njech8DJeYmwjO-s2bK1w.text: Great atmosphere and service. Unfortunately the food is prepared to leave the kitchen fast. I had the Buffalo Chicken Wedge which consisted of two chicken fingers, the kind you would find frozen at Costco and blue cheese obviously out of a 1 gallon jug.

uApNhxy9QRoy3BM07Crpig.text: We had a pretty poor experience here. My burger had no toppings. When they say Mushroom Swiss Burger, that's literally all you get. No condiments or anything. Our sides were cold when they came out. The bread was stale. The burger was smaller than other restaurants of a similar style. This restaurant could do way better if they didn't skimp the details. Based on the quality of the food, the prices are crazy.

okBfjyW_CUnprgluWdqVYA.text: They continue to fail with horrible customer service.  After 15 minutes with, I'll get to you, I left.  They dont know which stations are who's and not a smile among the staff.  The employees reflect a disorganized hateful environment.  They need to be closed down.  As I sat there watching them not wiping down the tables after they pick up the soiled dishes, only to sit someone else there to get ignored.  Avoid this place and head down to panda Express or Burger King.

1bZVwUQS2buxQgmLyq-q0A.text: Service is slow at a glacial pace. I'm here for breakfast, ordered eggs and sausage (this should take 5 minutes to cook tops)... 45 minutes later still not here. Server told me "your foods coming, ok!?" Hostess was not rude but not friendly. No one on staff really seems to give a crap. I'd say if you're in the airport, go somewhere else, but not much here beyond Burger King and cold sandwiches. Charlottes airport is terrible I should have flown through ohare.   I'm about ready to leave.

lqi0YNoEruPILX1xrmAAaQ.text: Terrible terrible terrible service. They were so concerned with the party that wasn't there that they kept redirecting me to a table I didn't want to sit at despite the entire place being 1/3 full. I was traveling with my esa service animal as I have flight anxiety so I guess maybe a bit more sensitivity to travelers who are literally hungry and just trying to grab a quick bite before the next flight would be nice. Maybe they don't like animals? However, they are to offer service to everyone. Right? Don't feel as though this would be a place to pick again in the airport but it was close to the E concourse so I dealt with it. The food was marginal and like I said the service was so poor and downright rude. However, here I am sipping my wine and I refuse to let this ruin my day as my goal is to share my experience with y'all out there. Choose any place but this one as they don't want to serve you unless you're more then one body. The belt buckles on the wall was cool to see though. Just service was bad.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine
Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. The place ..

4eHCCJIit00i_mBmEeP1dw.text: One of the few restaurants that are open in the Charlotte airport at 6am. The service at the bar was excellent. Jason was super. Heads up: they can't serve alcohol until 7am. Located in E gate area.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area

2YsU8BNLnw-IsjOxAon96w.text: This was a difficult review to write as I find airport restaurants (and I travel every week) to be 3 stars or less mostly because either the customer service is subpar or the food is mediocre to trash. In this case, the wait time was terrible. The design of the restaurant is very Nashville'ish with a live country singer, whisky barrels here or there and belt buckles hanging on the wall. They were completely packed so maneuvering around was a challenge.   It actually didn't take that long to be seated at one of my least favorite places, the infamous communal table. Another gentleman was seated right after me and across from me. We waited for quite a long time (15 minutes) for our server to come over to take our order. I was about ready to leave when he did come over. At that point I knew what I wanted to ordered a beer and a veggie burger. Another customer was seated right next to me and our server took his order a few minutes later. Both received their drink before I did and so I waited and waited. Eventually the server came over and told me that they had to change out the keg and he would bring my drink over. He did about 5 minutes later. About 5 minutes after that my food arrived and it was actually delicious.   My server came back over to check on me and I told him to bring my check since I knew it would take an hour or so to get it. He was fairly prompt with that.   So would I go back: yes. While the wait was terrible (1 star), the customer service was 4 star and the food was 5 star.

SfE3dh7VyEzKIBlFcGRKPQ.text: The hostess was slow, and I mean slow. Food was ok but over the top expensive. Our waitress was the only one that was working hard she got a nice tip. People were waiting to set, and the floor manager was cleaning tables. Looked like there was 8 or 9 servers but nothing was getting done. This place needs better workers.

Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

r5uCFWz6MNj63JCeI467iw.text: Dale's restaurant is just as bad as his driving.    Waited 15 minutes with no service.   Filled with people working their PC's long after they finished eating.    Saw a table with their $15 burger plate.  A miserable piece of cr_p.    Left and went to Burger King for 1/2 the price and a shorter wait.

0fjjyoXK2HmTRv-pUCHbrQ.text: Loved the people and food here. Servers were quick and very attentive. I got only the nachos but they were awesome.

HXQfn202u3wGUt-ymWntig.text: Wanted a sit down restaurant in the charlotte airport. Didn't want fast food. This place was very busy but figured lets give it a try. Extremely small menu. It's bar food. A few burger and fries. Wings salad etc. not much to choose from. The burger was definitely a frozen party. Fries were ok. But service was horrible. Though it was busy there was more than enough staff working and some standing around doing nothing yet the waitress never came to see if everything was ok. I flagged her down to ask for napkins and she never brought any then I finally had to flag her down to get my bill. I would have got a dessert if the waitress had ever come back to check on me. But I said forget it. Next time I am in this airport which is every few months I will not go here to eat    Best part was the pic I took of the food looked nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Whisky River at the Airport - Charlotte, NC, United States

mBUT3wfwO40Hu_2k_u9IDw.text: Had a 2-hour layover in Charlotte.  Tried this restaurant, and so glad that I did.  Okay, the service was slow, and maybe I should deduct a star, but the food was soooooo good.  I had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich with the BBQ sprinkled fries and an Olde Mecklenburg Lager.  Outstanding, all around.  I haven't had a meal that good in weeks.  Highly recommended, but ONLY if you have the time.

2eVERjx3CqJO86Z2DxRL2Q.text: This is the perfect place to grab some good food in this section of the Airport. I've been here several times and have always had a good experience. Friendly staff, good food, fast service! What else do you need?

46fjUmxOYRSaC8LSWkYqtQ.text: I was there on a Friday and they had a live band. I didn't ask, but since they have a small stage, I'm guessing it is a regular occurrence! I had the Texas Tequila Bacon Cheddar Burger. Yum!!!

vVik1wksx88sqHWwOHfbmw.text: I'm at the restaurant now. First off, I am very patient usually but, I feel like leaving. The service is two stars at best.  Just got my food sooo late, A salad, and it was not good.   Avoid if you can.

Fv7qFSiZD2dHGMWqShcf9Q.text: Had dinner here before my flight home. Airport directory suggested this was top rated for airport restraunts which reeled me in as they are often lacking. I had the brisket grilled cheese which was ok. They also had a decent beer selection. If your gate is nearby, you could do worse.

PrYH1b_avHrFRR4B8mAQSQ.text: Airport restaurants are typically disappointing, they are rushed, limited with their space, have logistics concerns, and you always have plastic-wear and sit elbow to elbow with other travelers.   This place was no different.   Tater tots and fries were solid, pulled pork was sub-par, the brisket grilled cheese wasn't too bad.   Try the pizza place next door or the Carolina Brewery if you're looking for better Terminal E eats.

FTQ1sF9ueGv88fiwoRu6Mg.text: I can't with an open heart give these guys a bad review. Me want burger, me eat burger, me full.
